question.title: Is it compatible MatrixParams in SWAGGER UI with JAXRS annotations?
question.body:
Im working on a project based on JAXRS annotations. Im configuring a Swagger UI to sumarize all the endpoints of the project and to execute them from there. Im implementing OAS 3 which supports MatrixParams according to their specification (see Does Swagger 2.0 support matrix parameters?).

However, after trying to execute methods which works with MatrixParams im realizing there's no possible to have MatrixParams in Swagger UI with JAXRS annotations.

Why? That's simple, JAXRS and Swagger UI supports MatrixParams in different ways.

Let's clarify with an example:

@GET @Path("example/get")
  @Produces(MediaType.APPLICATION_JSON)
    String getNotifierType(@MatrixParam("notifierType") String notifierType)
    throws CustomException;

  • JAXRS needs MatrixParam in method header. That's the way JAXRS knows in example/get endpoint there's an extra ;notifierType=x to fill MatrixParam.

  • Swagger UI needs to have a path like this example/get{notifierType}. So the method would be like this:

    @GET @Path("example/get{notifierType}")
   @Produces(MediaType.APPLICATION_JSON)
     String getNotifierType(@MatrixParam("notifierType") String notifierType)
     throws CustomException;

Here is the big problem, if we change the method to follow Swagger UI specification, there's no manner to execute it from the Swagger UI because JAXRS interpetes that the endpoint now is example/get{notifierType};notifierType=x

So Swagger UI generates the following CURL:

curl -X 'GET'
'https://localhost:8080/xyz/config/example/self;notifierType=email_local'
-H 'accept: application/json'

But now the endpoint expects the following curl:

curl -X 'GET'
'https://localhost:8080/xyz/config/example/self{notifierType};notifierType=email_local'
-H 'accept: application/json'

Is there any solution in this case? Is it possible to execute methods with MatrixParams in SWAGGER UI on a JAXRS based project?

Im going mad with that so any help is welcome :)

UPDATE

Image of Swagger UI generating curl without {notifierType} specification in @Path.

This image corresponds to this operation:

    @GET @Path("example/get")
  @Produces(MediaType.APPLICATION_JSON)
    String getNotifierType(@MatrixParam("notifierType") String notifierType)
    throws CustomException;

answers.body:
This is what I get when using Swagger UI 5.20.8 (from SmallRye: OpenAPI UI 4.0.10 (from Quarkus 3.22.3)):

The notifierType parameter will be treated as a object with a String field.

I don't think support for matrix parameters in OpenAPI will get any better than this.

question_comments.body: Hi @MarcosZolnowski, first of all thank you for the answer.   I've tried to remove {notifierType} from Path but Swagger UI is not automatically displaying it. I've attached to the question the image of the Swagger UI for an operation without {notifierType} in Path.  As you can see, it doesn't work because Swagger UI is not mapping input notifierType field into a valid syntax of MatrixParam in URL. In other words, it's generating the curl wihout ;notifierType=x but it is necessary to call the endpoint.

You need to remove the {notifierType} in @Path. Swagger UI will automatically display the URL with {notifierType}. If this is not happening, you need to attach to the question what you see in the Swagger UI.

79656368.body: Hi @MarcosZolnowski, thank your for the screenshot. I've checked this scenario with Quarkus + SmallRye and that's true, it works. I've been searching for a explanation and the one who is more logic is that Quarkus and SmallRye re-implements OAS improving several functionalities and adding new ones. One of this funcionalities is the possibility of execute MatrixParam in Swagger UI.      In other words, for me it doesnt work because i have native Swagger (OAS 3.0.1) in a Maven project without frameworks like Quarkus.
